result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J Boros was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary J Boros is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary J Boros was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence but granted defendant credit for 4 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: *Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*NO contact with his mother or brother.

*Court will consider expungement if the defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding; and only if all costs are paid in full.

*Mental Health assessments and treatment.
*Take all prescribed medications.
*Must write a letter of apology to his mother. Letter given to the agent.

*Absolute sobriety.
*AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 45 days at the HOC for any violations to be used  at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary J Boros

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions For Expungement

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider expungement if the defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding; and only if all costs are paid in full.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court withheld sentence, but granted Defendant credit for 4 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed Defendant on probation for a period of 1 year
with the following conditions: 
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Mental Health assessments and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  No contact with his mother or brother.
*  MUST write a letter of apology to his mother. Letter given to the agent.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 45 Days condition time at the House of Correction (HOC) for any violations to be used at the discretion of the agent.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding; and only if all costs are paid in full.

Received and filed with court:
*  Pretrial Incarceration credit Form

Defendant Zachary J Boros in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

 47. Justice point report received and filed. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Linda B. or Austin B.

Defendant Zachary J Boros in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Zachary J Boros in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
